title: Rugby World Cup 2019: Scotland call-up Magnus Bradbury after Jamie Ritchie injury scare
text: Scotland back-row Magnus Bradbury has been handed a seat on the plane to Japan after team-mate Jamie Ritchie suffered a facial injury. Ritchie will remain in Scotland while the squad fly out to Japan on Monday morning but could still make the World Cup. The Edinburgh flanker suffered a deep wound to his face during Friday’s final warm-up win over Georgia at BT Murrayfield. We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras. The Scottish Rugby Union stated that Bradbury would travel as “precautionary injury cover”. A statement added: “Ritchie sustained a facial injury in the national team’s 36-9 win over Georgia at BT Murrayfield on Saturday and – following specialist scans at Spire Murrayfield Hospital – will remain in Scotland for specialist assessment, with the outcome influencing whether he remains part of the 31-man group for the Rugby World Cup which begins later this month.” Ritchie was the most serious of five injury concerns to come from the game and the other four players are set to travel. – experienced hamstring issues. PA
description: Scotland back-row Magnus Bradbury has been handed a seat on the plane to Japan after team-mate Jamie Ritchie suffered a facial injury. Ritchie will remain in Scotland while the squad fly out to Japan on Monday morning but could still make the World Cup. The Edinburgh flanker suffered a deep wound to his face during Friday’s final warm-up win over Georgia at BT Murrayfield.
